title: Albert Einstein was a physicist. What is his qualification as a mathematician? - Quora

response.answer_text: None. All physicists use mathematics. Einstein didn’t invent any new mathematical methods or prove any theorems. He used mathematics. A degree in physics is sufficient qualification for the application of mathematics. That said, he did use some math that was not normally required for physics. For that he had to study independently. He also enlisted the help of mathematicians.

I exactly don’t know but I know that at an age of 15 or 16 he mastered calculus and he was interested only in studying mathematics. Once when he asked his maths teacher to give some proofs if his maths qualification at school, his teacher wrote that Albest can teach him.
